feed.title: Learn-Jekyll Test Site
feed.subtitle: Write an awesome description for your new site here. You can edit this line in _config.yml. It will appear in your document head meta (for Google search results) and in your feed.xml site description.

entry.title: Another post
entry.content:
This is just another post. See how to include data inside your posts:

Beatles Discography

  • My Bonnie (released on 5 January 1962)
  • Please Please Me (released on 22 March 1963)
  • With the Beatles (released on 22 November 1963)
  • Les Beatles (released on November 1963)
  • Introducing... The Beatles (released on 10 January 1964)
  • Meet the Beatles! (released on 20 January 1964)
  • Twist and Shout (released on 3 February 1964)
  • The Beatles' Second Album (released on 10 April 1964)
  • The Beatles' Long Tall Sally (released on 11 May 1964)
  • A Hard Day's Night (US) (released on 26 June 1964)
  • A Hard Day's Night (UK) (released on 10 July 1964)
  • Something New (released on 20 July 1964)
  • Beatles for Sale (released on 4 December 1964)
  • Beatles '65 (released on 15 December 1964)
  • Beatles VI (released on 14 June 1965)
  • Help! (UK) (released on 6 August 1965)
  • Help (US) (released on 13 August 1965)
  • Rubber Soul (UK) (released on 3 December 1965)
  • Rubber Soul (US) (released on 6 December 1965)
  • Yesterday and Today (released on 20 June 1966)
  • Revolver (UK) (released on 5 August 1966)
  • Revolver (US) (released on 8 August 1966)
  • Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band (released on 1 June 1967)
  • Magical Mystery Tour (released on 27 November 1967)
  • The Beatles ("The White Album") (released on 22 November 1968)
  • Yellow Submarine (released on 17 January 1969)
  • Abbey Road (released on 26 September 1969)
  • Let It Be (released on 8 May 1970)
entry.summary: This is just another post. See how to include data inside your posts:

entry.title: Welcome to Jekyll!
entry.content:
You’ll find this post in your _posts directory. Go ahead and edit it and re-build the site to see your changes. You can rebuild the site in many different ways, but the most common way is to run jekyll serve, which launches a web server and auto-regenerates your site when a file is updated.

To add new posts, simply add a file in the _posts directory that follows the convention YYYY-MM-DD-name-of-post.ext and includes the necessary front matter. Take a look at the source for this post to get an idea about how it works.

Jekyll also offers powerful support for code snippets:

Check out the Jekyll docs for more info on how to get the most out of Jekyll. File all bugs/feature requests at Jekyll’s GitHub repo. If you have questions, you can ask them on Jekyll Talk.

What’s next?

See another post or head back to homepage. (Check this paragraph to see the magic behind the links.)
entry.summary: You’ll find this post in your _posts directory. Go ahead and edit it and re-build the site to see your changes. You can rebuild the site in many different ways, but the most common way is to run jekyll serve, which launches a web server and auto-regenerates your site when a file is updated.
